intro: Pimpinella dichotoma, commonly known as the twinleaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves that are divided into two pairs of lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of theApiaceae family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Pimpinella dichotoma is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
